channel.title: Delete Locked Threads
channel.description:
Hey mates,
I think that locked threads should be deleted. The reason for this is because there is no point in keeping them on this forum, and they waste space. There are numerous threads that have been locked on here because people don't follow the rules or make stupid threads which get filled up with spam. Instead of locking threads, moderators or mopar should delete them. If you want to let the person who made the thread know what they did wrong or let everyone know then keep the thread up for a day. Make some setting that locked threads delete the next day automatically. Good Idea?
Your friend, Leader

item.title: Delete Locked Threads
item.dc:creator: @irfan786 irfan786
item.description:
@irfan786 wrote:

frank_:

Also, before a thread was required to be locked, it may have contained informative material, so should not be removed.

Thats exactly what I was going to say.

Read full topic

item.title: Delete Locked Threads
item.dc:creator: @Algas Algas
item.description:
@Algas wrote:

Locking threads makes users understand what kind of topic should not be posted here or what kind of behaving shouldn’t be in threads.

Lazyness for locking topic and not removing it? 3 buttons lyes in bottom of the page:

Move Topic  |  Remove Topic  |  Lock topic

Read full topic

item.title: Delete Locked Threads
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:10, topic:15899”]I think not. Mods have the powers to hide threads, I belive.[/quote]If threads should be deleted, they are typically moved the the Rubbish Bin forum…so although it is no longer public, it can still be accessed if need be. I also don’t like moving spam topics there since it just looks to people as if it just disappeared and was deleted, possibly leading to another spam topic…so I just lock it and leave it.

Read full topic

item.description:

I thought we just kept them locked to act as a lesson for others, though it could be something as simple as laziness… idk, your idea sounds fine, though some people dont check the forums every day and thus they will be like “wtf… my thread dissappeared”
